title: Tentatek Splattershot
paragraphs: The Tentatek Splattershot is a main weapon in the Splatoon series. It is the Tentatek-branded version of the Splattershot.
The Tentatek Splattershot's appearance in each game is based on the default Splattershot variant from the same game with an added Tentatek branding.
In Splatoon, the sticker of Tentatek's oval logo is pasted on both sides of the gun's ink tank.
In Splatoon 2, a white tape strip bearing Tentatek's logo and wordmark wraps the gun's ink tank in a diagonal position.

In Splatoon 3, the gun's whole ink tank and its strap is recolored hot pink with a white embossed Tentatek's figure 8 logo and the brand's white wordmark beneath the logo on both sides of the ink tank.

The Tentatek Splattershot is an all-around weapon in terms of power, range, and rate of fire, making it easy to use for players of all levels of experience. When utilized, it sprays a steady splattering of ink until the player's ink tank is depleted. It comes in a set with Suction Bombs and the Inkzooka.

The Tentatek Splattershot returns in Splatoon 2, now based on the Splattershot's redesign in that game, and differs in appearance with a banner wrapped around the ink reservoir with a Tentatek logo. It comes with Splat Bombs and the Inkjet.

The Tentatek Splattershot returns in Splatoon 3 with a new design, coming with Splat Bombs and the Triple Inkstrike. It was added to the game as part of the Chill Season 2022 update on 1 December 2022.

- From Versions 1.3.0 to 2.3.0 of Splatoon 2, the Tentatek Splattershot's Inkjet required 230p to fully charge, being one of only 2 weapons in the entire Splatoon series to have had a special points requirement greater than 220p, the other weapon being the Ballpoint Splatling Nouveau in Splatoon 2.

- After its announcement for Splatoon 3's Chill Season 2022 update, the Tentatek Splattershot's special weapon was not initially revealed. The confirmation of Triple Inkstrike's inclusion happened indirectly before the update released, as it appears on the weapon's Tableturf Battle card art.
- This weapon is Goggles' general weapon in the first two volumes of the Splatoon Manga.

Tentatek Splattershot is a combination of splatter (as well as splat) and shot. It has the Tentatek brand name as a prefix to differentiate it from the Splattershot. It also denotes that the weapon is a collaboration with Tentatek.

Its Japanese name, スプラシューターコラボ supurashūtā korabo, is a combination of either splat or splash, and shooter. It also has the abbreviated prefix collab to separate it from Splashooter and to denote that it is a collaboration. However, unlike the English name, it does not specify the brand Tentatek.
